greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n in its prime divisors with at least one part of size 1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Coefficient of x^(n-1) in expansion of (1/(1-x))*1/Product_{d is prime divisor of n} (1-x^d). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Apr 11 2004
program: \\ This is for computing just a moderate number of terms:

partitions_into_with_trailing_ones(n,parts,from=1) = if(!n,1, if(#parts<=(from+1), if(#parts == from,1,(1+(n\parts[from]))), my(s=0); for(i=from,#parts,if(parts[i]<=n, s += partitions_into_with_trailing_ones(n-parts[i],parts,i))); (s)));
(PARI) \\ For an efficient program to compute large numbers of terms, see _David A. Corneth_'s PARI program included in the Links section. - _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 12 2018
results.author: _Olivier Gérard_
